repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:    No way to check the reference count of objects.
Solution:   Add test_refcount(). (Ozaki Kiichi, closes vim/vim#4124)

https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c3e92c161d6394d126a334011526c02e8c3f655f

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

This doesn't modify internal state and does add test coverage.

Plan to add more `v:_` variables (unit) test coverage.

----

Vim doesn't throw exceptions when stringifying `null` function/partials. `:let` will trigger the exceptions when stringifying these internal `v:_null_` variables.

```diff
diff --git a/src/nvim/eval/encode.c b/src/nvim/eval/encode.c
index 79f3346..729e0b4 100644
--- a/src/nvim/eval/encode.c
+++ b/src/nvim/eval/encode.c
@@ -376,8 +376,7 @@ int encode_read_from_list(ListReaderState *const state, char *const buf, const s
   do { \
     const char *const fun_ = (fun); \
     if (fun_ == NULL) { \
-      internal_error("string(): NULL function name"); \
-      ga_concat(gap, "function(NULL"); \
+      ga_concat(gap, "function(NULL)"); \
     } else { \
       ga_concat(gap, "function("); \
       TYPVAL_ENCODE_CONV_STRING(tv, fun_, strlen(fun_)); \
```

comment_data.body:
Neovim doesn't allow in-place changes of readonly variables as expected.
Vim wouldn't throw exception here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1387,9 +1394,10 @@ func Test_null_list()
   call assert_equal([], l[:2])
   call assert_true([] == l)
   call assert_equal('[]', string(l))
-  " call assert_equal(0, sort(l))
-  " call assert_equal(0, sort(l))
-  " call assert_equal(0, uniq(l))
+  " call assert_equal(0, sort(v:_null_list))

comment_data.body: New error code needs v8.2.1949. Restore test in that patch.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1399,15 +1407,20 @@ func Test_null_list()
   call assert_equal([], deepcopy(l))
   call assert_equal(5, get(l, 2, 5))
   call assert_equal(-1, index(l, 2, 5))
-  " call assert_equal(0, insert(l, 2, -1))
+  " call assert_equal(0, insert(v:_null_list, 2, -1))
+  call assert_fails('call insert(l, 2, -1)', 'E742:')

comment_data.body: Both should fail similar to `v:_null_list` behavior.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1420,22 +1433,27 @@ func Test_null_dict()
   call assert_equal({}, d)
   call assert_equal(0, len(d))
   call assert_equal(1, empty(d))
+  call assert_equal([], items(v:_null_dict))
   call assert_equal([], items(d))
+  call assert_equal([], keys(v:_null_dict))
   call assert_equal([], keys(d))
+  call assert_equal([], values(v:_null_dict))
   call assert_equal([], values(d))
   call assert_false(has_key(d, 'k'))
   call assert_equal('{}', string(d))
-  call assert_fails('let x = d[10]')
+  call assert_fails('let x = d[10]', 'E716:')
   call assert_equal({}, {})
   call assert_equal(0, len(copy(d)))
   call assert_equal(0, count(d, 'k'))
   call assert_equal({}, deepcopy(d))
   call assert_equal(20, get(d, 'k', 20))
   call assert_equal(0, min(d))
   call assert_equal(0, max(d))
-  call assert_equal(0, remove(d, 'k'))
+  call assert_equal(0, remove(v:_null_dict, 'k'))
+  " call assert_fails("call remove(d, 'k')", 'E716:')

comment_data.body: `v:_null_partial` needs to allow `string: function(NULL)` and similar loose type checking adjustments to not break existing tests (ie. `:let`).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -7158,11 +7160,11 @@ func Test_refcount()
       call assert_equal(-1, test_refcount(test_null_job()))
       call assert_equal(-1, test_refcount(test_null_channel()))
     endif
-    call assert_equal(-1, test_refcount(test_null_function()))
-    call assert_equal(-1, test_refcount(test_null_partial()))
-    call assert_equal(-1, test_refcount(test_null_blob()))
-    call assert_equal(-1, test_refcount(test_null_list()))
-    call assert_equal(-1, test_refcount(test_null_dict()))
+    call assert_equal(-1, test_refcount(v:_null_function))
+    " call assert_equal(-1, test_refcount(test_null_partial()))

comment_data.body: This can be cherry-picked but any `test_` functions should be skipped or modified to disable failing cases.

```
    patch 8.2.4526: Vim9: cannot set variables to a null value
    
    Problem:    Vim9: cannot set variables to a null value.
    Solution:   Add null_list, null_job, etc.
```

Vim(9) has `handle_predefined()` to define these as values, not variables.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -277,6 +277,7 @@ static struct vimvar {
   VV(VV_STDERR,           "stderr",           VAR_NUMBER, VV_RO),
   VV(VV_MSGPACK_TYPES,    "msgpack_types",    VAR_DICT, VV_RO),
   VV(VV__NULL_STRING,     "_null_string",     VAR_STRING, VV_RO),
+  VV(VV__NULL_FUNC,       "_null_function",   VAR_FUNC, VV_RO),

2025-08-04T20:41:13.4966782Z 	Caught exception in Test_AAA_python3_setup(): Vim(return):E5108: Lua: Vim:<string>:5: SyntaxWarning: invalid escape sequence '\('�stack traceback:�	[C]: at 0x56186fa19d38 @ command line..script /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/test/old/testdir/runtest.vim[652]..function RunTheTest[61]..Test_AAA_python3_setup[66]..provider#python3#Call, line 1
2025-08-04T20:41:13.4966794Z

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1,9 +1,79 @@
 " Test for python 3 commands.
-" TODO: move tests from test87.in here.
 
 source check.vim
 CheckFeature python3
 
+" This function should be called first. This sets up python functions used by
+" the other tests.
+func Test_AAA_python3_setup()

comment_data.body: was expecting a memory leak in the ASAN build without the testcase from https://github.com/vim/vim/pull/5003 v8.1.2107. I suppose they're all caught in the vim-patch port of the prompt_buffer feature.

comment_regular_data.body:
Can we use unit tests with FFI instead? Why is this needed in the end-user interface? It's an internal detail of vimscript.

> Plan to add more `v:_` variables (unit) test coverage.

We should avoid these. They are legacy cruft.

While this MR is in draft mode, I'll do all of the patches first and then try to port these as unit tests using LuaJIT FFI in the end.

These don't need to be exposed for end-user;  it's just for porting and coverage.
I can remove the `desc` to avoid adding new entries to `runtime/doc/` .

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability.
repo.name: neovim

title: vim-patch:8.1.1044,8.2.{299,307,331,334,493,512,1123,1555,1912,1951,3380}
